nodes.text: Disney Magic Kingdoms is a world-building game developed by Gameloft. Three Star Wars-themed updates were released between 2019 and 2021.

Players build their own Disney park using characters and attractions from Disney, Pixar, and Star Wars. Maleficent has cursed the kingdom, and it's up to Merlin, Mickey Mouse, and the other characters to remove the curse and restore the kingdom to its former glory. The game has a dedicated Star Wars area, with permanent and limited-time Star Wars characters and attractions that players can unlock.

Permanent characters and attractions are unlocked throughout the storyline. Limited-time characters and attractions are only available for the duration of an event, and then made available through Legendary Chests that players can buy with gems or real money.

In the Star Wars portion of the main storyline, C-3PO is tasked with exploring an uncharted territory in the player's kingdom for the Resistance. After welcoming C-3PO, players unlock the Star Wars area in the kingdom.
Finn, Poe Dameron, and Rey set out to stop General Hux, Kylo Ren, and the First Order from occupying territory in the kingdom.

Framed as a flashback, C-3PO reads off a Datacard from the Nevarro chapter of the Bounty Hunters' Guild. Set during the events of The Mandalorian's first season, The Mandalorian, Greef Karga, and Cara Dune work together to get past the Imperials in order to allow The Mandalorian and The Child to escape from Nevarro.
As C-3PO reviews his data banks, he recalls the series of events that led to the Battle of Yavin.

A Star Wars-themed area is available for players to unlock after doing storyline quests with C-3PO, containing three unlockable plots of land. The area is surrounded by buildings, objects, and decorations from Tatooine, Hoth, Endor, Jakku, Takodana, and Ahch-To. Star Wars attractions placed in the area garner 15% more magic.
